description: Naan is a popular Indian flatbread known for its soft and fluffy texture. It's traditionally made in a tandoor oven, but you can easily make it at home using a skillet or oven.
steps: In a small bowl, combine active dry yeast, sugar, and warm water. Let it sit for 5-10 minutes until frothy.
In a large mixing bowl, combine all-purpose flour, salt, baking powder, and yogurt. Mix well.

Add the yeast mixture to the flour mixture and knead until you have a smooth and elastic dough. If the dough is too dry, add a little more warm water. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rest in a warm place for about 1 hour, or until it doubles in size.
Once the dough has doubled in size, punch it down and divide it into equal-sized balls.
Preheat your skillet or oven to high heat.
Roll out each dough ball into a thin oval or round shape, about 1/4 inch thick.
Place the rolled-out dough onto the skillet or baking sheet and cook for 1-2 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and puffy.
Brush each naan with melted butter and sprinkle with minced garlic and chopped coriander leaves if desired.
Serve hot and enjoy your homemade naan with your favorite curry or dip!
